name: SIUT
mission: Established in 2000, SIUT North America is a charitable organization under Section 501(c)(3). It is dedicated to health-related humanitarian causes, with its major focus on helping Sindh Institute of Urology and Transplantation (SIUT) Pakistan secure vital medical funds so all patients are treated free of charge and without discrimination.
theoryOfChange: SIUT North America raises and provides funding/grants to SIUT Pakistan so patients receive lifesaving, world-class medical treatment completely free of cost and with dignity, ensuring no patient is turned away due to financial hardship.
zakatClaimEvidence: SIUT North America, Inc. has a 'Select a campaign' option on Kindful that includes 'Zakat'. Additionally, Feeling Blessed states, 'Your Zakat and Sadaqah has the power to save lives. Donate to SIUTNA and help us provide free healthcare with dignity.' (Source: https://siutna.org/ways-to-donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 44/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: Beneficiary count appears implausible; CPB excluded pending review
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

all_citations.claim: The charity holds a score of 92.0/100 and demonstrates high financial accountability.
The organization provides grants for medicine and medical equipment.
Grants are paid specifically for medical equipment and medicine to support healthcare operations.
The organization provides grants and assistance to foreign organizations for medical purposes.
The charity focuses its spending on medicine and equipment grants.
The organization offers various donation options and is Zakat-eligible.
The organization reported total revenue of $5,921,512.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a solid GMG score of 79/100 due to its direct service impact and high alignment with humanitarian needs. Its financial health is bolstered by efficient fundraising and a strong commitment to program spending.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital is limited to 4.0 months, which may impact long-term sustainability during funding fluctuations
Heavy reliance on international grants for medical equipment and medicine procurement

dimension_explanations.alignment: SIUT North America shows high alignment for donors seeking urgent humanitarian causes, specifically within the healthcare sector [1]. Its status as a Zakat-eligible organization further strengthens its fit for Muslim donors looking to fulfill religious obligations through medical relief [6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates direct impact by funding essential medical interventions, including kidney transplants and dialysis, as evidenced by its grants for medical equipment and medicine [3][5]. With a program expense ratio of 84.0%, the organization efficiently converts donations into healthcare services [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: SIUT North America Inc provides critical financial support for life-saving kidney transplants and dialysis treatments for patients in need.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 84.0%, ensuring the majority of funds support medical services
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.17 per $1 raised
Recognized as Zakat-eligible, providing a verified pathway for Islamic charitable giving
baseline_narrative.summary: SIUT North America Inc serves as a primary funding vehicle for the SIUT Charitable Trust, focusing on diagnostic measures, dialysis, and kidney transplants [2][4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $5,921,512 and maintains a high level of financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 92.0/100 [1][7].

alignment.explanation: The organization has a <cite id="17">high Muslim donor fit</cite> as it is Zakat-eligible and serves <cite id="8">vulnerable populations in a Muslim-majority region</cite>.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this organization due to its <cite id="11">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and <cite id="12">fully independent board governance</cite>.
credibility.improvement: Credibility could be further enhanced by publishing detailed annual impact reports that link specific dollar amounts to the number of transplants performed.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Directly funds the medical equipment and pharmaceutical needs of SIUT Karachi.

rich_narrative.headline: SIUT North America Inc provides critical financial support for life-saving kidney transplants and dialysis treatments for patients in need.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fund high-impact, life-saving medical procedures for the poor in Pakistan through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible vehicle.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill Zakat obligations for medical causes
Value high-transparency organizations with Platinum Candid status
Prefer funding tangible medical equipment and medicine
giving_considerations: Donations primarily fund a single large-scale implementing partner
Focus is on tertiary care (transplants/dialysis) rather than preventative medicine
High financial efficiency means nearly every dollar reaches the field
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking local US-based medical impact or those who prioritize primary care and preventative health education over surgical interventions.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks specific financial outputs (grants for equipment) and has <cite id="18">one outcome metric tracked via Candid</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SIUT North America provides the financial resources necessary for SIUT Karachi to maintain its 'Free with Dignity' model, ensuring that lack of funds never prevents a patient from receiving a transplant or dialysis.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that the high cost of transplants results in successful patient outcomes and long-term survival.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The demand for dialysis and transplants in Pakistan far exceeds current capacity, allowing the charity to absorb significant additional funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="9">84.0% program expense ratio</cite> and focus on specialized tertiary care rather than general primary health.
similar_orgs: Helping Hand for Relief and Development

similar_organizations.name: Helping Hand for Relief and Development

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="9">program expense ratio of 84.0%</cite> according to recent filings, with a <cite id="10">fundraising efficiency of $0.17 per $1 raised</cite>.
SIUT North America holds a <cite id="11">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and features a <cite id="12">84.0% independent board of directors</cite>.
The charity has demonstrated robust expansion with a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 18.9%</cite>, increasing its capacity to fund complex surgeries.

strengths_deep_dive: SIUT North America's operational model is characterized by its lean administrative structure and high-impact grantmaking. The organization successfully manages to direct the vast majority of its resources to its mission, as evidenced by <cite id="13">$5,136,716 in foreign grants</cite> delivered to its implementing partner in Pakistan. This efficiency is further bolstered by strong leadership and culture scores, both receiving <cite id="14">perfect 100/100 ratings from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their ability to maintain <cite id="15">4.0 months of working capital</cite> provides a stable foundation for ongoing medical commitments while ensuring that funds are not sitting idle but are instead actively deployed for patient care.
rich_narrative.summary: SIUT North America Inc serves as a critical financial lifeline for the Sindh Institute of Urology and Transplantation (SIUT) in Pakistan, an institution renowned for providing free-of-cost specialized medical care. <cite id="1">founded in 2000</cite>, the organization focuses on mobilizing resources for <cite id="2">life-saving kidney transplants, dialysis, and cancer treatments</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the charity reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $5,921,512</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="4">three-year revenue CAGR of 18.9%</cite>. The organization operates with high financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="5">92/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. A primary strength of the organization is its commitment to direct service delivery; in 2024, it disbursed <cite id="6">$5,141,716 in grants specifically for medical equipment and medicine</cite>. By funding the procurement of advanced technology and pharmaceuticals, SIUT North America ensures that patients in Pakistan—regardless of their socioeconomic status—have access to tertiary healthcare that would otherwise be unaffordable. The organization is <cite id="7">verified as Zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the <cite id="8">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> categories of asnaf, making it a trusted vehicle for Muslim donors seeking to fulfill their religious obligations through high-impact medical humanitarianism.
